function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"AI predictive models may have accuracy limitations and may not always provide accurate predictions for severe cases of COVID-19.","Impact":"Misdiagnosis and ineffective treatment of severe COVID-19 cases.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and calibration of AI models with real-world clinical data. Incorporation of human expertise in decision-making.","Technologies":"Real-time data collection and analysis, validation algorithms, human-in-the-loop AI.","People":"Patients, healthcare providers, medical suppliers.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, medical research institutions."},{"Description":"Repurposing of AI tools for COVID-19 screening and diagnosis may lead to errors and inaccuracies in test results.","Impact":"False negative or false positive COVID-19 test results, leading to the risk of disease spread or unnecessary quarantine.","Mitigation":"Rigorous testing and validation of repurposed AI tools. Multiple layers of verification and cross-checking with traditional diagnostic methods.","Technologies":"Quality assurance algorithms, cross-validation techniques, integration with traditional diagnostic tests.","People":"General public, healthcare authorities, government agencies.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Use of AI-based multisensory technology for COVID-19 screening may raise privacy and data security concerns for individuals being scanned.","Impact":"Unauthorized use of personal data, potential exploitation of sensitive health information.","Mitigation":"Strict adherence to data protection regulations and privacy laws. Transparent communication and consent processes for individuals being scanned.","Technologies":"Encryption and anonymization techniques, audit trails, secure data storage protocols.","People":"Individuals being scanned, data protection authorities, regulatory bodies.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, technology providers."}]}
